#summary CCF GSoC Application

= Introduction =

CCF is planning to be a Google Summer of Code organisation.  There will be an application to fill in, with questions similar to those listed in the FAQ:

http://www.google-melange.com/document/show/gsoc_program/google/gsoc2011/faqs#mentor_app


= Questions and Responses =

   1. Describe your organization.

Climate Code Foundation is a non-profit with the goal of promoting the public understanding of climate science.  We promote good software engineering practices amongst scientists, with a key emphasis on Open Source software.  Our goals are documented here: http://climatecode.org/about/goals/ and further information can be found at the Foundation home page: http://climatecode.org/

   2. Why is your organization applying to participate in Google Summer of Code 2011? What do you hope to gain by participating?

We hope to:
 - improve the public understanding of climate science;
 - increase the public visibility of CCF;
 - promote better practice amongst climate scientists;
 - foster the Open Source spirit amongst aspiring students.

   3. Did your organization participate in past Google Summer of Codes? If so, please summarize your involvement and the successes and challenges of your participation.

Did not participate.

   4. If your organization has not previously participated in Google Summer of Code, have you applied in the past? If so, for what year(s)?

Have not applied.

   5. What license(s) does your project use?

For source code, we use the 3-clause BSD licence: http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php

   6. What is the URL for your Ideas page?

http://code.google.com/p/ccc-gistemp/wiki/GSoC2011

   7. What is the main development mailing list for your organization?

http://groups.google.com/group/ccc-gistemp-discuss?pli=1

   8. What is the main IRC channel for your organization?

Don't currently have one [perhaps we should?].

   9. Does your organization have an application template you would like to see students use? If so, please provide it now.

[perhaps we should have on]

  11. What criteria did you use to select these individuals as mentors? Please be as specific as possible.

The criteria we used were:
 - availability;
 - commitment to the goals of the Foundation;
 - track record in managing software projects;
 - technical expertise in the relevant areas.
